external_references.description: Microsoft Threat Intelligence. (2024, September 26). Storm-0501: Ransomware attacks expanding to hybrid cloud environments. Retrieved October 19, 2025.
Microsoft Threat Intelligence. (2025, August 27). Storm-0501’s evolving techniques lead to cloud-based ransomware. Retrieved October 19, 2025.

external_references.source_name: Google Mandiant Storm-0501 Sabbath Ransomware November 2021
external_references.description: Tyler McLellan, Brandan Schondorfer. (2021, November 29). Kitten.gif: Meet the Sabbath Ransomware Affiliate Program, Again. Retrieved October 19, 2025.

objects.description: [Storm-0501](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1053) has exfiltrated stolen data to the MEGA file sharing site.(Citation: Google Mandiant Storm-0501 Sabbath Ransomware November 2021) [Storm-0501](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1053) has also utilized [Rclone](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1040) to exfiltrate data from victim environments to cloud storage such as MegaSync.(Citation: Microsoft Storm-501 Sabbath Ransomware Embargo September 2024) [Storm-0501](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1053) has exfiltrated data to their own infrastructure utilizing AzCopy Command-Line tool (CLI).(Citation: Microsoft Storm-0501 Embargo Ransomware August 2025)
